quizzes.question_text:
41 miners need to ride the elevator to the bottom of the mine. The elevator can hold 6 miners at a time. How many miners will be in the elevator on its last trip?


_ miners
solution: Divide the total number of miners by the number of miners the elevator holds.

This gives you 6. These are the number of trips made with 6 miners on each trip.
The remainder is 5. This means there will be 5 miners in the elevator on its last trip.
solution_image_tag: Long division showing 41 ÷ 6 = 6 R5. The quotient 6 is written above with 'R5' indicating the remainder. The calculation shows 41 - 36 = 5, demonstrating that 6 groups of 6 can be made with 5 remaining.

This gives you 10. These are the number of trips made with 6 pencils on each trip.
The remainder is 5. This means there will be 5 pencils in the box on its last trip.
solution_image_tag: Long division showing 65 ÷ 6 = 10 R5. The quotient 10 is written above with 'R5' indicating the remainder. The calculation shows 65 - 60 = 5, demonstrating that 10 groups of 6 can be made with 5 remaining.

quizzes.question_text:
60 Naruto ninjas need to cross the bridge. The bridge can hold 9 ninjas at a time. How many ninjas will cross on the last trip?


_ ninjas
solution: Divide the total number of ninjas by the number the bridge holds.

This gives you 6. These are the number of trips made with 9 ninjas at a time on each trip.
The remainder is 6. This means there will be 6 ninjas in the bridge on its last trip.
solution_image_tag: Long division showing 60 ÷ 9 = 6 R6. The quotient 6 is written above with 'R6' indicating the remainder. The calculation shows 60 - 54 = 6, demonstrating that 6 groups of 9 can be made with 6 remaining.
